ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This class could be stronger, but the field trips are very useful.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The best class ever. Extremely helpful and very thoughtful.
The student-driven aspect was great, as was the opportunity to meet with leaders in the working environment as well as prominent FES alums.

Combination of the field trips and presentation offered by students. I was able to gain basic leadership theory through students' presentation, and was able to see its appreciation from field trips. Also, I was able to learn a lot from my classmates
The faculty, trip planning and actual field trips
Students' presentation, field trip, and the leadership from students in organizing the field trip.

The field trips were great, and Professor Oliver does an amazing job of connecting students with leaders across many fields. The class format of student lectures was also great - getting other views of a leadership-related subject was very interesting.
Meeting leaders in New York and Washington D.C. And, interacting with fellow classmates.
Field trips!

The best parts of this course are the field trips and the student presentations. The field trips to New York City and Washington D.C. allowed students to meet with leaders in the places that they work. This turned out to be a very powerful experience! The leaders' stories and insights were very personal, which made them all the more meaningful. The leaders also represented a broad array of levels and organizations, and they each genuinely seemed to enjoy speaking with us about their journeys. The student presentations were also very interesting. The topics were broad, which allowed each student to steer the topic in a direction that spoke to his or her personal experiences or ambitions.
Field trips to meet with leaders in NYC and DC.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: None.
This course is so well planned organized and needs no change.
nothing
There is very little that I would improve about this class! I thought it was excellent!
Lecture material- content was lacking and disorganized.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: it was effective enough
Very effective.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: A compulsory component of MF requirements.
This course is mandatory for graduating as MF
It complements & supplements with all other courses by teaching the necessary people management skills required to work in any kind of organization.
As (hopefully) a future leader in one way or another, this class is an important way to build critical skills.
As future leaders, it is important for students to understand the values and norms of leadership. This course will prove useful in developing skills, strategies, and tactics for a lifetime.

This class is a requirement for the MF degree (it is a capstone course). I am SO GLAD that it is required, because I may have otherwise brushed it aside. I didn't know how much I needed the information in this class until it started. The more I began to learn, the more interested in the topic I became. There are very few classes that inspire you to go beyond the required work and explore the topics on your own... but this is one of them!
This course allowed me to connect with several FES alumni.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: A compulsory component of MF requirements.
Required by my degree, but at the same time, I was interested in learning about the leadership theory
I have been in various leadership roles, and this course was required to help me understand an international perspective
Learning the philosophy and techniques on leadership.

I took this class to fulfill the capstone requirement for the MF degree. But the class turned out to be so much more than that! I am so glad that it was required, or else I may have missed out on an INCREDIBLE opportunity.
To learn more about important leadership skills and to meet with various (sometimes FES) leaders.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, above and beyond.
Knowledge and skills gained from the course were more than my expectations!
Yes. It was learning with fun and passion.
Beyond my expectations.
Yes.
Yes, definitely

What I gained from this class exceeded my expectations. It made me think much more purposefully about the kind of employee I want to be, the kind of leader I want to be, the role that I can play in an organization, and the principles that I choose to abide by as I progress through my career. This course has struck the perfect balance between reflection and projection.
Somewhat. The field trips were great.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Teamwork creates a better product than individual work.
Learnt international group dynamics
We learned to acknowledge the diversity of the group and to harmonize the diversity to achieve the same goal. I would say the class is excellent for this!

For this course, the students work in one big group--with each student having a role within in the class "organization"--to plan the field trips to D.C. and NYC. This was a great way to get some experience performing different roles in an organization, and it was especially helpful to practice managing others.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would strongly recommend to take this class!
You will be assigned a role in the organization, try to act to its deepest level to learn the most.

The excellency of the class also depends on students' performance. The instructor only gives you the guidance. How much you want to gain from the class depends on how much efforts you want to put for it. Field trips to NYC and Washington DC are amazing experiences to learn leadership from various people from various background, and to expand your networking in case you are looking for a job.
This class presents a good opportunity to learn about leadership subjects and network on field trips.
Be water. Be flexible and approach the course as opportunity.
Take it!!!!

I could not recommend this course more highly! This is a course for MF's, MEM's, MFS's, and MESc's! It provides a really great space to talk about the challenges and opportunities that we will all face as we leave school and re-enter the workforce... and as we progress through our careers. Also, this class requires an average amount of work, with one substantial (but essential!) 3-day field trip to D.C.
Expect to get the most out of the field trips. The lectures were not as helpful.
